    • The Three Goal Model

    • Reflections

  • Session 2 – Decision-making and bias
    • Session 2 – Overview
    • Introduction to decision-making and bias
    • Heuristic processing
    • Systematic processing
    • What are cognitive biases?
    • Do you fall into the bias trap?

    • Case study – Mary and Tahlia
    • Emotions
    • The value of insight

  • Session 3 – Information gathering
    • Session 3 – Overview

    • Testimonials

    • Information from other people
    • Reflections
    • Additional resources and references
  • Session 4 – Informed choice
    • Session 4 – Overview
    • Introduction to making informed choices
    • What is informed choice?
    • Family-centred care
    • Learning from the professionals
    • Your values and preferences
    • A question to ask yourself
    • The SURE Test
    • Case study – The Cheng and Moore families
    • Decision aids
    • Case study – Putting it all together
    • Reflections
    • Additional resources and references

Information gathering


Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information on it.

Samuel Johnson

Knowledge and understanding are the cornerstones of making an informed choice. When we make informed decisions, we need to be knowledgeable about the issues which are important and relevant for that decision. In this session, we look at the three main sources of information for parents and the pros and cons of each of these.
Session content
